Class DNSServer

java.lang.Object
Devices.Device
Devices.DNSServer
public class DNSServer extends Device
Represents a DNS server in the network simulation. Responsible for resolving domain names to IP addresses and managing DNS records.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Izzy Kavanagh

      public DNSServer(String name, String macAddress)
      Constructs a DNS server with the given name and MAC address.

      name - - the name of the DNS server
      macAddress - - the MAC address of the server

    • getTotalPorts

      public int getTotalPorts()
      Returns the number of ports available on this DNS server.
      Overrides:
      getTotalPorts in class Device
      Returns:
      the number of ports (always 1)

    • resolveDomain

      public String resolveDomain(String domainName)
      Resolves a domain name to its corresponding IP address using the DNS records
      Parameters:
      domainName - - the domain name to resolve
      Returns:
      the corresponding IP address, or null if not found

    • printDnsRecords

      public void printDnsRecords()
      Prints all DNS records stored in this server

    • addDnsRecord

      public void addDnsRecord(Scanner scanner, DNSServer dnsServer)
      Adds a new DNS record by accepting user input through the console Associates a domain name with a web server's IP address
      Parameters:
      scanner - - a Scanner object used to read user input
      dnsServer - - the DNS server to which the record is being added (not strictly necessary)
